question: Will the number of lawsuits filed against the Trump Administration according to the JustSecurity tracker be greater than or equal to 36 and less than or equal to 40 on March 31, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered, the Just Security litigation tracker currently lists 132 cases against the Trump Administration as of March 20, 2025. This number is significantly higher than the range of 36 to 40 lawsuits specified in the question for a "YES" resolution. 

Given the current number of lawsuits and the fact that the tracker is continually updated, it is highly unlikely that the number of lawsuits will decrease to fall within the specified range by March 31, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.0

search_results.content:
---
title: Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions
author: Just Security
url: https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/
hostname: justsecurity.org
description: A public resource tracking the legal challenges to the Trump administration's executive orders and actions.
sitename: Just Security
date: 2025-03-20
categories: ['Courts', 'Executive Branch', 'Litigation']
---
This public resource tracks legal challenges to Trump administration actions. If you think we are missing anything, you can email us at [lte@justsecurity.org](mailto:lte@justsecurity.org). Special thanks to *Just Security* Student Staff Editors Anna Braverman, Isaac Buck, Rick Da, Charlotte Kahan, and Jeremy Venook, and to Matthew Fouracre and Nour Soubani.

The Tracker is part of the [Collection: Just Security‚Äôs Coverage of the Trump Administration‚Äôs Executive Actions](https://www.justsecurity.org/106653/collection-trump-administration-executive-actions/). Readers may also be interested in [signing up](https://www.justsecurity.org/early-edition-signup/) for our free Early Edition roundup of news and our end-of-day newsletter with *Just Security* articles from the day (We respect your privacy. We do not use your email address for any other purpose except to automatically send you the requested email.)

*The Tracker was first published on Jan. 29, 2025 and is continually updated. Last updated March 20, 2025.*

Total number of cases tracked: 132 (including 2 closed cases)


Topic | Executive Action | Case Name | Complaint | Date Filed | Case Summary | Last Update |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Immigration and Citizenship | Executive Action: Alien Enemies Act removals (
|
J.G.G. v. Trump |

Case No. 1:25-cv-00766

(D.C. Cir

[No. 25-5067](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69742127/jgg-v-donald-trump/))

[Habeas petition](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.278436/gov.uscourts.dcd.278436.1.0.pdf)**Overview:***President Trump issued a presidential proclamation purporting to invoke the Alien Enemies Act to allow for summary removal of alleged members of the Venezuelan Tren de Aragua (TdA) gang. Plaintiffs filed a class action lawsuit arguing the 1798 statute does not apply to these circumstances, and the judge provisionally agreed issuing a temporary block to any removals until further hearings.*

**Summary:**On Mar. 14, President Trump signed a[Proclamation](https://www.whitehouse.gov/preside‚Ä¶

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the number of lawsuits filed against the Trump Administration according to the JustSecurity tracker be greater than or equal to 36 and less than or equal to 40 on March 31, 2025?
Background: [Collection: Just Security‚Äôs Coverage of the Trump Administration Executive Actions](https://www.justsecurity.org/106653/collection-trump-administration-executive-actions/) | [Elon Musk: Can someone start a lawsuit counter? How long until we hit triple digits? ü§£ü§£](https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1881711703504875596)
Resolution criteria: This question resolves as YES if the number of legal challenges to the Trump Administration listed at [this tracker](https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-legal-challenges-trump-administration-actions/) when accessed by Metaculus on or after March 31, 2025 is greater than or equal to 36 and less than or equal to 40. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.
Fine print: 
present_date: 2025-03-22T16:56:25.272482


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "snippet": "---
title: Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions
author: Just Security
url: https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/
hostname: justsecurity.org
description: A public resource tracking the legal challenges to the Trump administration's executive orders and actions.
sitename: Just Security
date: 2025-03-20
categories: ['Courts', 'Executive Branch', 'Litigation']
---
This public resource tracks legal challenges to Trump administration actions. If you think we are missing anything, you can email us at [lte@justsecurity.org](mailto:lte@justsecurity.org). Special thanks to *Just Security* Student Staff Editors Anna Braverman, Isaac Buck, Rick Da, Charlotte Kahan, and Jeremy Venook, and to Matthew Fouracre and Nour Soubani.

The Tracker is part of the [Collection: Just Security’s Coverage of the Trump Administration’s Executive Actions](https://www.justsecurity.org/106653/collection-trump-administration-executive-actions/). Readers may also be interested in [signing up](https://www.justsecurity.org/early-edition-signup/) for our free Early Edition roundup of news and our end-of-day newsletter with *Just Security* articles from the day (We respect your privacy. We do not use your email address for any other purpose except to automatically send you the requested email.)

*The Tracker was first published on Jan. 29, 2025 and is continually updated. Last updated March 20, 2025.*

Total number of cases tracked: 132 (including 2 closed cases)


Topic | Executive Action | Case Name | Complaint | Date Filed | Case Summary | Last Update |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Immigration and Citizenship | Executive Action: Alien Enemies Act removals (
|
J.G.G. v. Trump |

Case No. 1:25-cv-00766

(D.C. Cir

[No. 25-5067](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69742127/jgg-v-donald-trump/))

[Habeas petition](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.278436/gov.uscourts.dcd.278436.1.0.pdf)**Overview:***President Trump issued a presidential proclamation purporting to invoke the Alien Enemies Act to allow for summary removal of alleged members of the Venezuelan Tren de Aragua (TdA) gang. Plaintiffs filed a class action lawsuit arguing the 1798 statute does not apply to these circumstances, and the judge provisionally agreed issuing a temporary block to any removals until further hearings.*

**Summary:**On Mar. 14, President Trump signed a[Proclamation](https://www.whitehouse.gov/preside…

[Truncated preview: showing 299 words out of ~10545. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]", "word_count": 10545, "snippet_word_count": 299, "snippet_truncated": true, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-22T16:56:25.272482", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-23T16:56:25.272482", "cached_at": "2025-10-23T19:58:25.909222"}

messages.content: {"question_id": "af8383de-09b2-5548-a21f-644b727e2f17", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "facts": [{"title": "Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "fact": "The total number of cases tracked by the Just Security litigation tracker is 132 as of March 20, 2025."}, {"title": "Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "fact": "The tracker includes 2 closed cases, indicating ongoing updates and potential for new cases to be added."}, {"title": "Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "fact": "The tracker was first published on January 29, 2025, and is continually updated, with the last update on March 20, 2025."}, {"title": "Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "fact": "Recent cases involve challenges to executive orders on immigration and citizenship, indicating active legal opposition to Trump Administration policies."}, {"title": "Litigation Tracker: Legal Challenges to Trump Administration Actions", "url": "https://www.justsecurity.org/107087/tracker-litigation-legal-challenges-trump-administration/", "fact": "The tracker is part of a broader collection of Just Security's coverage of Trump Administration executive actions, suggesting a comprehensive approach to documenting legal challenges."}]}
messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered, the Just Security litigation tracker currently lists 132 cases against the Trump Administration as of March 20, 2025. This number is significantly higher than the range of 36 to 40 lawsuits specified in the question for a "YES" resolution. 

Given the current number of lawsuits and the fact that the tracker is continually updated, it is highly unlikely that the number of lawsuits will decrease to fall within the specified range by March 31, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.0
